org.grouplens.grapht.reflect

Interface Desire

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ReflectionDesire

    public interface Desire
extends Serializable
    A possibly-not-concrete type. This represents the type of a dependency; it may or may not be concrete. It can effectively be any type. Desires are iteratively resolved and narrowed until they finally correspond to Satisfactions.
    Author:
    GroupLens Research

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Class<?> getDesiredType() 
      InjectionPoint getInjectionPoint() 
      Satisfaction getSatisfaction()
      Get the satisfaction (concrete type) if this desire is fully resolved.
      boolean isInstantiable()
      Query whether this desire is instantiable, that is, resolved to a concrete type.
      Desire restrict(Class<?> type)
      Return a new Desire that restricts the type of this desire to the given class.
      Desire restrict(Satisfaction satisfaction)
      Return a new Desire that restricts the type of this desire to the erased type of the satisfaction.

    • Method Detail

      • isInstantiable

        boolean isInstantiable()
        Query whether this desire is instantiable, that is, resolved to a concrete type. If it is instantiable, then it can be converted to a Satisfaction with getSatisfaction().
        Returns:
        true if the desire is for a concrete class. The only further desires or satisfactions that can satisfy it are for subclasses of the desire type.

      • getSatisfaction

        Satisfaction getSatisfaction()
        Get the satisfaction (concrete type) if this desire is fully resolved.
        Returns:
        The satisfaction for this desire, or null if the desire is not a concrete type.

      • getInjectionPoint

        InjectionPoint getInjectionPoint()
        Returns:
        The injection point of this desire

      • getDesiredType

        Class<?> getDesiredType()
        Returns:
        The desired type, potentially more constrained than the injection point's type

      • restrict

        Desire restrict(Class<?> type)
        Return a new Desire that restricts the type of this desire to the given class. The type must be a subclass of the desired type.
        Parameters:
        type - The restricted type
        Returns:
        A restricted Desire

      • restrict

        Desire restrict(Satisfaction satisfaction)
        Return a new Desire that restricts the type of this desire to the erased type of the satisfaction. The returned Desire will also be instantiable and return the provided satisfaction from getSatisfaction().
        Parameters:
        satisfaction - The satisfaction to restrict this desire to
        Returns:
        A restricted and satisfied desire
